text.div:
EDQM - RouteOfAdministration

Valueset RouteOufAdministration from EQM, ROA, export 24.4.2018, see https://standardterms.edqm.eu/#

  • Include these codes as defined in urn:oid:0.4.0.127.0.16.1.1.2.1
    CodeDisplayComments
    20001000Auricular useNote: Administration of a medicinal product to the ear.
    20002500Buccal useNote: Administration of a medicinal product to the buccal cavity (pouch located between the cheek and the gum) to obtain a systemic effect
    20003000Cutaneous useNote: Administration of a medicinal product to the skin and/or cutaneous wounds and/or nails and/or hair in order to obtain a local effect.
    20004000Dental useNote: Administration of a medicinal product to and/or in the teeth or, on and/or around the nerves supplying the teeth.
    20006000Endocervical useNote: Administration of a medicinal product to the cervix uteri.
    20007000Endosinusial useNote: Administration of a medicinal product to the sinuses to obtain a local effect.
    20008000Endotracheopulmonary useNote: Administration of a medicinal product to the trachea and/or bronchiae by instillation (preparations for inhalation are excluded; see inhalation use).
    20009000Epidural useNote: Injection of a medicinal product into the epidural space.
    20010000Epilesional useNote: Administration of a medicinal product onto a lesion.
    20011000Extraamniotic useNote: Injection of a medicinal product between chorion and amnion.
    20011500Extracorporeal useNote: Use of a medicinal product outside the body
    20013000Gastroenteral useNote: Administration of a medicinal product to the stomach or duodenum gastroenteral tract by means of an appropriate device. For use only when gastric use and intestinal use do not apply.
    20013500Gastric useNote: Administration of a medicinal product to the stomach by means of an appropriate device
    20014000Gingival useNote: Administration of a medicinal product to the gingivae.
    20015000HaemodialysisNote: Clearance of the blood by means of a semipermeable membrane. [Previous English term 'Hemodialysis' corrected 04/07/11.]
    20015500ImplantationNote: Insertion of an implant or living tissue equivalent into living tissue.
    20019500InfiltrationNote: Method of administration, usually by injection, whereby a fluid passes into a target tissue (e.g. anaesthetic infiltration)
    20020000Inhalation useNote: Administration of a medicinal product to the respiratory system by inhalation to obtain a systemic or a local effect in the lower respiratory tract. Nasal use and endotracheopulmonary use are excluded
    20021000Intestinal useNote: Administration of a medicinal product to the intestine (duodenum, jejunum, ileum and colon) by means of an appropriate device. Gastroenteral use is excluded
    20022000Intraamniotic useNote: Injection of a medicinal product into the amniotic cavity.
    20023000Intraarterial useNote: Injection of a medicinal product into an artery.
    20024000Intraarticular useNote: Injection of a medicinal product into an articular cavity.
    20025000Intrabursal useNote: Injection of a medicinal product into bursae and tendons.
    20025500Intracameral useNote: Administration of a medicinal product directly into the anterior chamber of the eye
    20026000Intracardiac useNote: Injection of a medicinal product into the cardiac muscle and/or cardiac cavity.
    20026500Intracartilaginous useNote: Administration of a medicinal product into the cartilage
    20027000Intracavernous useNote: Injection of a medicinal product into the corpus cavernosum.
    20027010Intracerebral useNote: Administration of a medicinal product directly to the brain tissue.
    20028000Intracervical useNote: Injection of a medicinal product into the cervix uteri.
    20028300Intracholangiopancreatic useNote: Injection of a medicinal product into the bile duct and the pancreatic duct, for example via a cannula introduced into the ampulla of Vater (the common opening of the ducts), usually for the administration of a contrast medium for techniques such as endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography (ERCP).
    20028500Intracisternal useNote: Administration of a medicinal product into the Cisterna Magna
    20029000Intracoronary useNote: Injection of a medicinal product into the coronary artery.
    20030000Intradermal useNote: Injection of a medicinal product into the dermis.
    20031000Intradiscal useNote: Injection of a medicinal product into the nucleus pulposus of an intervertebral disc.
    20031500Intraepidermal useNote: Administration of a medicinal product into the epidermis
    20031700Intraglandular useNote: Administration of a medicinal product directly into a gland, usually by injection. Only to be used where more-specific terms such as 'Intraprostatic use' and 'Intramammary use' do not apply.
    20032000Intralesional useNote: Administration by injection or any other means of a medicinal product directly to a lesion.
    20033000Intralymphatic useNote: Injection of a medicinal product into a lymphatic vessel.
    20035000Intramuscular useNote: Injection of a medicinal product into muscular tissue.
    20036000Intraocular useNote: Administration of a medicinal product into the eye. The term 'intraocular use' is only for use when a more specific term (e.g. 'intracameral use', 'intravitreal use') does not apply. Ocular use and subconjunctival use are excluded.
    20036500Intraosseous useNote: Administration of a medicinal product into the bone marrow. Intrasternal use is excluded.
    20037000Intrapericardial useNote: Injection of a medicinal product to the pericardium.
    20038000Intraperitoneal useNote: Injection of a medicinal product into the peritoneal cavity.
    20039000Intrapleural useNote: Injection of a medicinal product into the pleural cavity.
    20039200Intraportal useNote: Injection/infusion of a medicinal product into the hepatic portal vein for local delivery to the liver.
    20039500Intraprostatic useNote: Administration of a medicinal product into the prostate
    20041000Intrasternal useNote: Injection of a medicinal product into the bone marrow of the sternum.
    20042000Intrathecal useNote: Injection of a medicinal product through the dura to the subarachnoid cavity.
    20043000Intratumoral useNote: Injection of a medicinal product into a tumor.
    20044000Intrauterine useNote: Administration of a medicinal product to the cavity of the uterus.
    20045000Intravenous useNote: Injection of a medicinal product into a vein.
    20046000Intravesical useNote: Administration of a medicinal product to the urinary bladder.
    20047000Intravitreal useNote: Administration of a medicinal product into the rear chamber of the eye.
    20047500IontophoresisNote: Introduction of (an) ionised active substance(s) through the intact skin by application of a direct electric current
    20048000Laryngopharyngeal useNote: Administration of a medicinal product to the laryngopharynx for a local effect (anaesthetics).
    20049000Nasal useNote: Administration of a medicinal product to the nose to obtain a systemic or local effect. Inhalation therapy intended for the lower respiratory tract is excluded; see inhalation use.
    20051000Ocular useNote: Administration of a medicinal product upon the eyeball and/or conjunctiva.
    20053000Oral useNote: Taking a medicinal product by means of swallowing.
    20054000Oromucosal useNote: Administration of a medicinal product to the oral cavity to obtain either a systemic or a local effect. The term oromucosal is only for use when a more specific term (e.g. buccal, gingival, sublingual...) does not apply. Oral use is excluded.
    20055000Oropharyngeal useNote: Administration of a medicinal product to the oropharynx (throat) to obtain a local effect.
    20057000Periarticular useNote: Injection of a medicinal product around a joint.
    20058000Perineural useNote: Injection of a medicinal product into the direct surroundings of one or more nerves.
    20059000Periodontal useNote: Administration to the pouch between the tooth and the gingiva.
    20059300Periosseous useNote: Administration of a medicinal product on or around the bone
    20059400Peritumoral useNote: Administration of a medicinal product directly into the region surrounding a tumour.
    20059500Posterior juxtascleral useNote: Administration of a medicinal product beneath the sub-tenon membrane of the sclera (i.e. in the episcleral space), adjacent to the macula.
    20061000Rectal useNote: Administration of a medicinal product to the rectum in order to obtain a local or systemic effect.
    20061500Retrobulbar useNote: Administration of a medicinal product behind the eyeball
    20062000Route of administration not applicableNote: Applies to medicinal products not directly coming into contact with the body of the patient, or administration to various or non-specified anatomical sites.
    20063000Skin scarificationNote: Administration of a medicinal product by scratching the skin.
    20065000Subconjunctival useNote: Injection of a medicinal product underneath the conjunctiva.
    20066000Subcutaneous useNote: Injection of a medicinal product directly underneath the skin, i.e. subdermally
    20067000Sublingual useNote: Administration of a medicinal product under the tongue to obtain a systemic effect.
    20067500Submucosal useNote: Injection of a medicinal product directly underneath a mucosa
    20070000Transdermal useNote: Administration of a medicinal product to the skin in order to obtain a systemic effect after passing through the skin barrier.
    20071000Urethral useNote: Administration of a medicinal product to the urethra.
    20072000Vaginal useNote: Administration of a medicinal product to the vagina.
    20080000Intracerebroventricular useNote: Administration of a medicinal product into the cerebral ventricles (cerebral ventricular system) of the brain.
    20081000Subretinal useNote: Administration of a medicinal product between the sensory retina (neural retina) and the retinal pigment epithelium of the eye.

Additional Language Displays

name: RouteOfAdministrationEDQM
title: EDQM - RouteOfAdministration
description: Valueset RouteOufAdministration from EQM, ROA, export 24.4.2018, see https://standardterms.edqm.eu/#

extension.valueString: Administration of a medicinal product to the ear.
Administration of a medicinal product to the buccal cavity (pouch located between the cheek and the gum) to obtain a systemic effect
Administration of a medicinal product to the skin and/or cutaneous wounds and/or nails and/or hair in order to obtain a local effect.
Administration of a medicinal product to and/or in the teeth or, on and/or around the nerves supplying the teeth.
Administration of a medicinal product to the cervix uteri.
Administration of a medicinal product to the sinuses to obtain a local effect.
Administration of a medicinal product to the trachea and/or bronchiae by instillation (preparations for inhalation are excluded; see inhalation use).
Injection of a medicinal product into the epidural space.
Administration of a medicinal product onto a lesion.
Injection of a medicinal product between chorion and amnion.
Use of a medicinal product outside the body
Administration of a medicinal product to the stomach or duodenum gastroenteral tract by means of an appropriate device. For use only when gastric use and intestinal use do not apply.
Administration of a medicinal product to the stomach by means of an appropriate device
Administration of a medicinal product to the gingivae.
Clearance of the blood by means of a semipermeable membrane. [Previous English term 'Hemodialysis' corrected 04/07/11.]
Insertion of an implant or living tissue equivalent into living tissue.
Method of administration, usually by injection, whereby a fluid passes into a target tissue (e.g. anaesthetic infiltration)

Administration of a medicinal product to the respiratory system by inhalation to obtain a systemic or a local effect in the lower respiratory tract. Nasal use and endotracheopulmonary use are excluded
Administration of a medicinal product to the intestine (duodenum, jejunum, ileum and colon) by means of an appropriate device. Gastroenteral use is excluded
Injection of a medicinal product into the amniotic cavity.
Injection of a medicinal product into an artery.
Injection of a medicinal product into an articular cavity.
Injection of a medicinal product into bursae and tendons.
Administration of a medicinal product directly into the anterior chamber of the eye
Injection of a medicinal product into the cardiac muscle and/or cardiac cavity.
Administration of a medicinal product into the cartilage
Injection of a medicinal product into the corpus cavernosum.
Administration of a medicinal product directly to the brain tissue.
Injection of a medicinal product into the cervix uteri.

Injection of a medicinal product into the bile duct and the pancreatic duct, for example via a cannula introduced into the ampulla of Vater (the common opening of the ducts), usually for the administration of a contrast medium for techniques such as endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography (ERCP).
Administration of a medicinal product into the Cisterna Magna
Injection of a medicinal product into the coronary artery.
Injection of a medicinal product into the dermis.
Injection of a medicinal product into the nucleus pulposus of an intervertebral disc.
Administration of a medicinal product into the epidermis
Administration of a medicinal product directly into a gland, usually by injection. Only to be used where more-specific terms such as 'Intraprostatic use' and 'Intramammary use' do not apply.
Administration by injection or any other means of a medicinal product directly to a lesion.
Injection of a medicinal product into a lymphatic vessel.
Injection of a medicinal product into muscular tissue.

Administration of a medicinal product into the eye. The term 'intraocular use' is only for use when a more specific term (e.g. 'intracameral use', 'intravitreal use') does not apply. Ocular use and subconjunctival use are excluded.
Administration of a medicinal product into the bone marrow. Intrasternal use is excluded.
Injection of a medicinal product to the pericardium.
Injection of a medicinal product into the peritoneal cavity.
Injection of a medicinal product into the pleural cavity.
Injection/infusion of a medicinal product into the hepatic portal vein for local delivery to the liver.
Administration of a medicinal product into the prostate
Injection of a medicinal product into the bone marrow of the sternum.
Injection of a medicinal product through the dura to the subarachnoid cavity.
Injection of a medicinal product into a tumor.
Administration of a medicinal product to the cavity of the uterus.
Injection of a medicinal product into a vein.
Administration of a medicinal product to the urinary bladder.
Administration of a medicinal product into the rear chamber of the eye.
Introduction of (an) ionised active substance(s) through the intact skin by application of a direct electric current
Administration of a medicinal product to the laryngopharynx for a local effect (anaesthetics).

designation.value: zur Anwendung im Rachen und am Kehlkopf

extension.valueString: Administration of a medicinal product to the nose to obtain a systemic or local effect. Inhalation therapy intended for the lower respiratory tract is excluded; see inhalation use.
Administration of a medicinal product upon the eyeball and/or conjunctiva.
Taking a medicinal product by means of swallowing.

Administration of a medicinal product to the oral cavity to obtain either a systemic or a local effect. The term oromucosal is only for use when a more specific term (e.g. buccal, gingival, sublingual...) does not apply. Oral use is excluded.
Administration of a medicinal product to the oropharynx (throat) to obtain a local effect.

designation.value: zur Anwendung im Mund- und Rachenraum

extension.valueString: Injection of a medicinal product around a joint.
Injection of a medicinal product into the direct surroundings of one or more nerves.
Administration to the pouch between the tooth and the gingiva.
Administration of a medicinal product on or around the bone
Administration of a medicinal product directly into the region surrounding a tumour.
Administration of a medicinal product beneath the sub-tenon membrane of the sclera (i.e. in the episcleral space), adjacent to the macula.
Administration of a medicinal product to the rectum in order to obtain a local or systemic effect.
Administration of a medicinal product behind the eyeball
Applies to medicinal products not directly coming into contact with the body of the patient, or administration to various or non-specified anatomical sites.
Administration of a medicinal product by scratching the skin.
Injection of a medicinal product underneath the conjunctiva.
Injection of a medicinal product directly underneath the skin, i.e. subdermally
Administration of a medicinal product under the tongue to obtain a systemic effect.
Injection of a medicinal product directly underneath a mucosa
Administration of a medicinal product to the skin in order to obtain a systemic effect after passing through the skin barrier.
Administration of a medicinal product to the urethra.
Administration of a medicinal product to the vagina.
Administration of a medicinal product into the cerebral ventricles (cerebral ventricular system) of the brain.
Administration of a medicinal product between the sensory retina (neural retina) and the retinal pigment epithelium of the eye.
